snippet: A federal judge on Thursday approved a settlement meant to guarantee alternatives to segregation for mentally ill inmates in Massachusetts prisons.
abstract: Federal Judge Mark L Wolf approves a settlement meant to guarantee alternatives to segregation for mentally ill inmates in Massachusetts prisons; settlement results from 2007 lawsuit that sought to stop Massachusetts from placing mentally ill inmates with disciplinary problems in small isolation cells for up to 23 hours a day.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Thursday approved a settlement meant to guarantee alternatives to segregation for mentally ill inmates in Massachusetts prisons.

headline.seo: Deal to Reduce Isolation of Mentally Ill Inmates in Massachusetts
headline.main: Deal to Curb Isolation of Mentally Ill Inmates
headline.print_headline: Deal to Curb The Isolation Of Ill Inmates
